raw akas.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill
Rendezvous with Destiny: Churchill and FDR

akas: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (original title)
Rendezvous with Destiny: Churchill and FDR (working title)
akas from release info: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (original title)
Rendezvous with Destiny: Churchill and FDR (working title)

1.title: The Two Lions

episode of.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

1.plot: Arriving on the Battleship HMS Prince of Wales, Churchill and FDR secretly meet for the first time off Newfoundland on USS Augusta, to discuss fighting Hitler, By signing The Atlantic Charter they set ideals that shape the world thereafter.

2.title: The Battle for Britain

episode of.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

2.plot: As the British Expeditionary Force makes a miraculous escape, aided by the courage of skippers of hundreds of pleasure craft from the beaches of Dunkirk, alone Churchill's Spitfires fight Hitler in the skies over Britain, as FDR secretly sends aid by sea.

3.title: In the Lion's Den

episode of.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

3.plot: Churchill comes to live at the White House to plan the course of the war. A challenge for Eleanor, these "School boys" and oft' late night drinking pals cement their relationship and future strategy. WSC and FDR spend 113 days together during the war, meeting 9 times in all.

4.title: The Russian Jackal

episode of.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

4.plot: "Uncle Joe" Stalin plays both sides of the seemingly unshakable Anglo-American alliance, cleverly sidelining Churchill, fighting for an early European front, as none of the "Big Three" recognize the future power of China in Chiang Kai-shek.

5.title: The Long Goodbye

episode of.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill (TV Mini-Series 2016– )

5.plot: The British Empire is left at the Altar! Shortly after Yalta, Churchill cannot attend FDR's funeral. His sentimental picture of the "special relationship" is seen in a new light. FDR's anti-Imperialism has dismantled the old world that WSC stood for.

imdb.plot outline: Franklin Delano Roosevelt was the 32nd President of the USA and the only one to be elected for four consecutive terms. He was the central figure in world events in the mid-Century and dominant leader of the Democratic Party and American liberalism. Winston Spencer Churchill's 90 years of life almost exactly coincided with the rise and decline of the British Empire. From an era when the sun ever set on a Empire that stretched to the far corners of a globe painted in red, with a young lieutenant that fought in the last great cavalry charge, to his final years in the 1950s as Britain's leader who unwillingly oversaw the return of those far flung lands to their peoples. On becoming Prime Minister on May 10, 1940 from a despondent, ineffectual government, Churchill made a series of inspiration speeches as he rallied a country standing alone against Hitler. In one of his most famous, "We shall fight on beaches," a lesser known line, "[We] will carry on the struggle until in God's good time the New World with all its power and might, sets forth to the liberation and rescue of the Old" especially caught FDR's attention. To his aide Harry Hopkins, "Now England has a man, a man we can do business with." FDR, although anti-Imperialist and determined to shut down the British Empire for good, he was entranced by Churchill's speeches and magnetism from their first meeting on USS Augusta and that first Sunday service on HMS Prince of Wales in Placentia Bay. These two Lions of the 20th Century met 9 separate times for a total of 113 days. "Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill" is the story of that time, of those days: how they won the War over Nazism and left their indelible mark on the World to this day.
imdb.title: Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill
plot: Franklin Delano Roosevelt was the 32nd President of the USA and the only one to be elected for four consecutive terms. He was the central figure in world events in the mid-Century and dominant leader of the Democratic Party and American liberalism. Winston Spencer Churchill's 90 years of life almost exactly coincided with the rise and decline of the British Empire. From an era when the sun ever set on a Empire that stretched to the far corners of a globe painted in red, with a young lieutenant that fought in the last great cavalry charge, to his final years in the 1950s as Britain's leader who unwillingly oversaw the return of those far flung lands to their peoples. On becoming Prime Minister on May 10, 1940 from a despondent, ineffectual government, Churchill made a series of inspiration speeches as he rallied a country standing alone against Hitler. In one of his most famous, "We shall fight on beaches," a lesser known line, "[We] will carry on the struggle until in God's good time the New World with all its power and might, sets forth to the liberation and rescue of the Old" especially caught FDR's attention. To his aide Harry Hopkins, "Now England has a man, a man we can do business with." FDR, although anti-Imperialist and determined to shut down the British Empire for good, he was entranced by Churchill's speeches and magnetism from their first meeting on USS Augusta and that first Sunday service on HMS Prince of Wales in Placentia Bay. These two Lions of the 20th Century met 9 separate times for a total of 113 days. "_Rendezvous with Destiny: Roosevelt and Churchill_ (qv)" is the story of that time, of those days: how they won the War over Nazism and left their indelible mark on the World to this day.::Christopher Toyne
